galaxy.summary: Control-FREEC is a tool for detection of copy-number changes and allelic imbalances (including LOH) using deep-sequencing data originally developed by the Bioinformatics Laboratory of Institut Curie (Paris). It automatically computes, normalizes, segments copy number and beta allele frequency (BAF) profiles, then calls copy number alterations and LOH.
galaxy.bio_tools_summary: A tool for control-free copy number alteration (CNA) and allelic imbalances (LOH) detection using deep-sequencing data, particularly useful for cancer studies.

related_workflows.name: Somatic variant discovery from WES tumor/normal sample pairs (hg38)
MIRACUM - somatic variant discovery from WES data (hg38 version)
